medical_history.chief_complaint: Memory problems as reported by the patient's son.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's son indicates that symptoms began about 2 months ago when he was unable to recall the names of some cousins at a family reunion. The patient believes his memory is no worse than others his age, although he admits to some difficulties in organizing past events.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 8-year history of hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide; previous episode of confusion diagnosed as a possible mini-stroke 8 years ago.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives alone, does not drink alcohol, completed high school and 1 year of business college, and worked as an insurance agent for 40 years. He talks to his son weekly and visits him every Sunday.
